text.div:
LinkIDTextCardinalityTypeDescription & Constraints
HIV.ARegistrationTODO: description goes hereQuestionnairehttp://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/Questionnaire/HIV.ARegistration#0.3.0
1Client's first or given name0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de1#Observation.value[x]
2Client's family name or last name0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de2#Observation.value[x]
3The date and time of the client's visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de3#Observation.value[x]
4If client was referred for care0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de4#Observation.value[x]
5How the client was referred0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de5#Observation.value[x]
6Unique identifier generated for new clients or a universal ID, if used in the country0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de8#Observation.value[x]
7National unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de9#Observation.value[x]
8National health unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de10#Observation.value[x]
9National programme unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de11#Observation.value[x]
10National health insurance unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de12#Observation.value[x]
11Country where the client was born0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de13#Observation.value[x]
12The client's date of birth (DOB) if known0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de14#Observation.value[x]
13Is the client's DOB is unknown?0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de15#Observation.value[x]
14If DOB is unknown, enter the client's estimated age. Display client's age in number of years.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de16#Observation.value[x]
15Calculated age (number of years) of the client based on date of birth0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de17#Observation.value[x]
16Gender of the client*0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de18#Observation.value[x]
17Additional category (please specify)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de24#Observation.value[x]
18Sex of the client assigned at birth0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de25#Observation.value[x]
19Client's home address or address which the client is consenting to disclose0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de29#Observation.value[x]
20Client's current marital status0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de30#Observation.value[x]
21Client's telephone number (a landline or a mobile phone number)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de42#Observation.value[x]
22This should be a context-specific list of administrative areas, such as villages, districts, etc. The purpose of this data element is to allow for grouping and flagging of client data to a particular facility's catchment area. This can be input into the system by the end user OR it can be automated in the database based on the end user's attributes.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de43#Observation.value[x]
23Indication that client gave consent to be contacted0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de44#Observation.value[x]
24Whether client wants to receive text or other messages as follow-up for HIV services0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de45#Observation.value[x]
25How the client would like to receive family planning communications0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de46#Observation.value[x]
26Client's primary email account where the client can be contacted0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de49#Observation.value[x]
27Name of an alternate contact, which could be next of kin (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.). The alternate contact would be used in the case of an emergency situation.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de50#Observation.value[x]
28Phone number of the alternate contact0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de51#Observation.value[x]
29Alternate contact's home address or address which the client is consenting to disclose0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de52#Observation.value[x]
30The alternate contact's relationship to the client (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-a-de53#Observation.value[x]

Documentation for this format

item.text: Client's first or given name
Client's family name or last name
The date and time of the client's visit
If client was referred for care
How the client was referred
Unique identifier generated for new clients or a universal ID, if used in the country
National unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country
National health unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country
National programme unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country
National health insurance unique identifier assigned to the client, if used in the country
Country where the client was born
The client's date of birth (DOB) if known
Is the client's DOB is unknown?
If DOB is unknown, enter the client's estimated age. Display client's age in number of years.
Calculated age (number of years) of the client based on date of birth
Gender of the client*
Additional category (please specify)
Sex of the client assigned at birth
Client's home address or address which the client is consenting to disclose
Client's current marital status
Client's telephone number (a landline or a mobile phone number)

This should be a context-specific list of administrative areas, such as villages, districts, etc. The purpose of this data element is to allow for grouping and flagging of client data to a particular facility's catchment area. This can be input into the system by the end user OR it can be automated in the database based on the end user's attributes.
Indication that client gave consent to be contacted
Whether client wants to receive text or other messages as follow-up for HIV services
How the client would like to receive family planning communications
Client's primary email account where the client can be contacted
Name of an alternate contact, which could be next of kin (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.). The alternate contact would be used in the case of an emergency situation.
Phone number of the alternate contact
Alternate contact's home address or address which the client is consenting to disclose
The alternate contact's relationship to the client (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.)
